Description:
AWARD PURPOSE
SINCE 1994, THE STATE OF UTAH, AS A RECIPIENT OF CONGRESSIONALLY- AUTHORIZED FLC GRANT FUNDS HAS PROVIDED DEVELOPMENT OF APPLICATIONS AND PREVAILING WAGE INFORMATION THAT PRECEDED THE CURRENT ONLINE WAGE LIBRARY (OWL). THE SYSTEMS, APPLICATION, AND END-USER INTERFACES HAVE EVOLVED OVER TIME, AND UTAH CURRENTLY HOSTS AND PROVIDES SOLE-ACCESS TO CRITICAL WAGE AND COMPENSATION DATA; AND CALCULATES BLS PROVIDED WAGE DATA TO ENSURE THE OFLC HAS 4 DISTINCT WAGE LEVELS CURRENTLY REQUIRED BY STATUTE 8 U. S. C. 1182 (P)(4). THE OWL IS A WEB-BASED TOOL AVAILABLE TO GLOBAL CONSUMERS, ON A 7X24 BASIS. OFLC IS PROPOSING A SOLE SOURCE AWARD TO UTAH DWS FOR A 12 MONTH PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE, AS AUTHORIZED BY FLC GRANT FUNDING LEGISLATION, TO CONTINUE THESE NEEDED SERVICES AND DATA AVAILABILITY.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
CONSIDERATION IS SOUGHT FOR A 12-MONTH SOLE SOURCE AWARD FROM FLC FY 2021 GRANT FUNDS TO THE STATE OF UTAH, DEPARTMENT OF WORKFORCE SERVICES, FOR CONTINUED AND ONGOING HOSTING, MAINTENANCE, UPDATES, AND SUPPORT OF THE FOREIGN LABOR CERTIFICATION "DATA CENTER", A WEB-BASED REPOSITORY OF INFORMATION USED BY DOL/ETA/OFLC AND OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES, REGULATED INDUSTRY PARTNERS AND EMPLOYERS SEEKING WAGE INFORMATION, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC. THE ACTIVITY TO BE FUNDED IS ESSENTIAL TO THE SATISFACTORY COMPETITION OF OFLC ACTIVITIES FUNDED BY DOL, AND COMPETING THIS ACTION WOULD RESULT IN SIGNIFICANT OR REAL HARM TO THE PUBLIC GOOD. THE ACTIVITY TO BE FUNDED IS ESSENTIAL TO THE SATISFACTORY COMPETITION OF OFLC ACTIVITIES FUNDED BY DOL, AND COMPETING THIS ACTION WOULD RESULT IN SIGNIFICANT OR REAL HARM TO THE PUBLIC GOOD.

DELIVERABLES
ON GOING WEBSITE MAINTENANCE, DATA MAINTENANCE, ARCHIVES AND REPORTING CAPABILITY.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
THE OWL IS INTEGRAL TO THE DAY TO DAY PROCESSING OF PWD REQUESTS WHICH ARE REQUIRED FOR ALL PERM AND H-2B EMPLOYER APPLICATIONS.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
Y

AWARD PURPOSE
TO ENSURE THAT U.S. WORKERS ARE NOTIFIED OF AVAILABLE JOB OPPORTUNITIES, THAT U.S. EMPLOYERS CAN MEET THEIR LABOR NEEDS WHEN QUALIFIED U.S. WORKERS ARE NOT AVAILABLE, AND THAT FOREIGN WORKERS ARE PROVIDED FAIR WAGES, WORKING CONDITIONS, AND ADEQUATE AND SAFE HOUSING.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES (SWAS) WILL REVIEW AND POST JOB ORDERS TO RECRUIT U.S. WORKERS FOR AVAILABLE POSITIONS, ENSURE THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF FARMWORKERS BY INSPECTING EMPLOYER-PROVIDED HOUSING, AND PROTECT WORKERS' WAGES BY CONDUCTING SURVEYS TO DETERMINE PREVAILING WAGES AND WORK STANDARDS.

DELIVERABLES
ADEQUATE AND SAFE HOUSING IS PROVIDED TO H-2A AGRICULTURAL WORKERS. TIMELY REVIEW AND POSTING OF JOB ORDERS. REFERRAL OF QUALIFIED AND AVAILABLE U.S. WORKERS TO JOB OPPORTUNITIES. STAKEHOLDER EDUCATION AND OUTREACH.


INTENDED BENEFICIARY
U.S. AND FOREIGN WORKERS. U.S. EMPLOYERS. 

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: TO ENSURE THAT U.S. WORKERS ARE NOTIFIED OF AVAILABLE JOB OPPORTUNITIES, THAT U.S. EMPLOYERS CAN MEET THEIR LABOR NEEDS WHEN QUALIFIED U.S. WORKERS ARE NOT AVAILABLE, AND THAT FOREIGN WORKERS ARE PROVIDED FAIR WAGES, WORKING CONDITIONS, AND ADEQUATE AND SAFE HOUSING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SWAS WILL REVIEW AND POST JOB ORDERS TO RECRUIT U.S. WORKERS FOR AVAILABLE POSITIONS FOR WHICH EMPLOYERS INTEND TO FILE APPLICATIONS FOR H-2A OR H-2B LABOR CERTIFICATION, ENSURE THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF FARMWORKERS BY INSPECTING EMPLOYER-PROVIDED HOUSING AND PROTECT WORKERS WAGES AND WORKING CONDITIONS BY CONDUCTING SURVEYS TO DETERMINE PREVAILING WAGES AND PRACTICE STANDARDS.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ADEQUATE AND SAFE HOUSING IS PROVIDED TO ALL H-2A WORKERS AND, AS APPLICABLE, U.S. WORKERS IN CORRESPONDING EMPLOYMENT AS REQUIRED BY 20 CFR 655.122(D)(1)(I) AND (II), AND 20 CFR 655.122(D)(2). PURPOSE: TO ENSURE THAT U.S. WORKERS ARE NOTIFIED OF AVAILABLE JOB OPPORTUNITIES, THAT U.S. EMPLOYERS CAN MEET THEIR LABOR NEEDS WHEN QUALIFIED U.S. WORKERS ARE NOT AVAILABLE, AND THAT FOREIGN WORKERS ARE PROVIDED FAIR WAGES, WORKING CONDITIONS, AND ADEQUATE AND SAFE HOUSING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SWAS WILL REVIEW AND POST JOB ORDERS TO RECRUIT U.S. WORKERS FOR AVAILABLE POSITIONS FOR WHICH EMPLOYERS INTEND TO FILE APPLICATIONS FOR H-2A OR H-2B LABOR CERTIFICATION, ENSURE THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF FARMWORKERS BY INSPECTING EMPLOYER- PROVIDED HOUSING AND PROTECT WORKERS WAGES AND WORKING CONDITIONS BY CONDUCTING SURVEYS TO DETERMINE PREVAILING WAGES AND PRACTICE STANDARDS.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ADEQUATE AND SAFE HOUSING IS PROVIDED TO ALL H-2A WORKERS AND, AS APPLICABLE, U.S. WORKERS IN CORRESPONDING EMPLOYMENT AS REQUIRED BY 20 CFR 655.122(D)(1)(I) AND (II), AND 20 CFR 655.122(D)(2).
